@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The Slider widget provides a vertical or horizontal slider. The Slider is the classic widget for controlling a bounded value. It lets the user move a slider handle along a horizontal or vertical groove and translates the handle's position into an integer value within the defined range. The Slider has very few of its own functions. The most useful functions are slideTo() to set the slider directly to some value; setSingleStep(), setPageStep() to set the steps; and setMinimum() and setMaximum() to define the range of the slider. A slider accepts focus on Tab and provides both a mouse wheel and a keyboard interface. The keyboard interface is the following:

  • Left/Right move a horizontal slider by one single step.
  • Up/Down move a vertical slider by one single step.
  • PageUp moves up one page.
  • PageDown moves down one page.
  • Home moves to the start (minimum).
  • End moves to the end (maximum). Here are the main properties of the class: # value: The bounded integer that {@link qx.ui.form.INumberForm} maintains. # minimum: The lowest possible value. # maximum: The highest possible value. # singleStep: The smaller of two natural steps that an abstract sliders provides and typically corresponds to the user pressing an arrow key. # pageStep: The larger of two natural steps that an abstract slider provides and typically corresponds to the user pressing PageUp or PageDown.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: knob {qx.ui.core.Widget} knob to set the value of the slider
@childControl.description: knob to set the value of the slider

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Change event for the value.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired as soon as the slide animation ended.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the enabled state was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the valid state was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the invalidMessage was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the required was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the slider is horizontal or vertical.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The current slider value. Strictly validates according to {@link #minimum} and {@link #maximum}. Do not apply any value correction to the incoming value. If you depend on this, please use {@link #slideTo} instead.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The minimum slider value (may be negative). This value must be smaller than {@link #maximum}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The maximum slider value (may be negative). This value must be larger than {@link #minimum}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The amount to increment on each event. Typically corresponds to the user pressing an arrow key.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The amount to increment on each event. Typically corresponds to the user pressing PageUp or PageDown.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Factor to apply to the width/height of the knob in relation to the dimension of the underlying area.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag signaling if a widget is valid. If a widget is invalid, an invalid state will be set.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag signaling if a widget is required.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Message which is shown in an invalid tooltip.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Message which is shown in an invalid tooltip if the {@link #required} is set to true.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for pointerover events at the knob child control. Adds the 'hovered' state

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for pointerout events at the knob child control. Removes the 'hovered' state

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of roll event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for keypress events. Adds support for arrow keys, page up, page down, home and end keys.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of pointerdown event. Initializes drag or tracking mode.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of pointerup event. Used for cleanup of previously initialized modes.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of pointermove event for the knob. Only used in drag mode.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of interval event by the internal timer. Only used in tracking sequences.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of resize event for both the slider itself and the knob.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Boolean} Whether the slider is laid out horizontally

@type.name: @type
@type.body:
{Integer} Available space for knob to slide on, computed on resize of
 the widget

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Computes the value where the tracking should end depending on the current pointer position.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Converts the given position to a value. Does not respect single or page step.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Converts the given value to a position to place the knob to.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Updates the knob position following the currently configured value. Useful on reflows where the dimensions of the slider itself have been modified.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Moves the knob to the given position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
position {Integer} Any valid position (needs to be
   greater or equal than zero)
@param.description:
Any valid position (needs to be
   greater or equal than zero)

@description.name: @description

@description.name: @description

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #zIndex}.
